Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw different habitats such as a playground, garden, or pond.
The student can show various types of living things, like trees, flowers, fish, or squirrels, in each habitat.
The student can compare and include in the drawing the diversity of plants and animals across different habitats.
The student can illustrate patterns by organizing similar living things in specific areas of their drawings.
The student can collect and reflect in their drawing observations from media or firsthand, showing evidence of biodiversity in different environments.
